Document type. An identifier used in your financial system to indicate the 
type of business transaction. For example, RE can indicate a Return. It is provided for Intrastat reporting purposes.
Amount of the line item not subject to tax due to exempt status.
Parent company fields are used when there is a need to see transaction events under the parent company currency. The exempt amount for the line item that is reported in the parent company currency.
Vertex indirect Tax returns field
This specifies the actual price of the line item. Item Amount x Qty - Discounts.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. This specifies the actual price of the line item. Item Amount x Qty - Discounts and is reported in the filing currency.

Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. Denotes specific revenue types or sources that the jurisdiction may require to be listed individually on the tax return. For example, 1022 (Property Rentals for Sweden).

Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The category code name associated with the category code representing the revenue types or sources that the jurisdiction may require to be listed individually on the tax return. For example, 1022 (Property Rentals for Sweden).
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The three-digit alpha (alpha-3) ISO 4217 Currency Code.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The exempt amount for the line item and is reported in the filing currency.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The non-taxable amount for the line item and is reported in the filing currency.

Parent company fields are used when there is a need to see transaction events under the parent company currency. The recoverable amount for the VAT line item and is reported in the parent company currency.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The recoverable amount for the VAT line item and is reported in the filing currency.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The taxable amount for the line item and is reported in the filing currency.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The amount of tax determined for the line item and is reported in the filing currency.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. Amount of tax for the entire invoice that is based on variables of the transaction and is reported in the filing currency.

Parent company fields are used when there is a need to see transaction events under the parent company currency. The unrecoverable amount for the VAT line item and is reported in the parent company currency.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The unrecoverable amount for the VAT line item and is reported in the filing currency.
This is the freight charge associated with the line item.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. This is the freight charge associated with the line item and is reported in the filing currency.
GL Account Reference - Accounting entry for relevant to the data represented at the either Tax level line level
GL Account Reference - Accounting entry for relevant to the data represented at the either Tax level line level or invoice level
GL Account Reference - Accounting entry for relevant to the data represented at the either Tax level line level or invoice level
GL Account Reference - Accounting entry for relevant to the data represented at the either Tax level line level or invoice level
The account string: For example: Company, Cost Center, Account, Product. The code combination for GL Account 1
The account string: For example: Company, Cost Center, Account, Product. The code combination for GL Account 2
The account string: For example: Company, Cost Center, Account, Product. The code combination for GL Account 3
The basis price at which the asset could be sold to the public. This could be an extended amount. In some systems, this is the gross line amount which includes the extended amount + freight + tax.
Filing fields are normally used for VAT return purposes. The basis price at which goods or services can be sold to the public and is reported in the filing currency.
The amount of input or import tax that the taxpayer is not able to recover.
The amount of input or import tax that the buyer is able to recover on a transaction. This is the amount that the buyer puts on their returns in order to recover these funds.
The percent of the tax that is recoverable as calculated and is based on the past recoverable amount/tax. Expressed as a decimal, such as: 1.0 for 100%, .8 for 80%, .5 for 50%.
Identifies whether tax is Input VAT, Output VAT, Both, Import, or No Tax according to the perspective of the transaction to allow for Reverse Charges.
A code used to represent groups or categories of products or services that have similar taxability. This can be a tax category value.
A name used to represent groups or categories of products or services with similar taxability.
The number of units included in the line item that is based on quantity and is not a currency amount. This value is applied on a line item basis to the quantity level of the product.

A code from the host system that identifies the product, material, service, or SKU number. This could be the same as a material code or an item code. If there is a need, this can be an alternate item code value.
A name from the host system that identifies the name of the product, material, service, or SKU number.

The date when VAT becomes due is called the “date of supply” or “tax point”. The tax point for goods is the transfer of ownership of the goods. The tax point for services is the date of completion of the service. VAT also becomes due on the date of the receipt of an advance payment for supplies of goods or services to the extent of the payment received.
